intro: Glechon hassleri, commonly known as the Mexican bellflower, is a flowering plant native to Mexico and parts of Central America. It belongs to the Campanulaceae family and is characterized by its bell-shaped, blue or violet flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and thrives in full sun to partial shade. Its foliage consists of narrow, grass-like leaves, and it is often cultivated for its ornamental value. Glechon hassleri is known for its drought tolerance and ability to bloom throughout the growing season.
